Quizzes.quizz_title: Lesson 1: FortiGate Firewall and Security Basics

questions.question: How does FortiGate check content for spam or malicious websites?
answer: Local verification using a downloaded web filter database locally on FortiGate
Live queries to FortiGuard over UDP or HTTPS
questions.correct_answer: Live queries to FortiGuard over UDP or HTTPS

questions.question: What must be selected in the Source field of a firewall policy?
answer: At least one source user and one source address object
At least one address object or ISDB
questions.correct_answer: At least one address object or ISDB

questions.question: What is the purpose of the policy lookup feature on FortiGate?
answer: To find a matching policy based on input criteria
To block traffic based on input criteria
questions.correct_answer: To find a matching policy based on input criteria

questions.question: Which is a more accurate description of a modern firewall?
answer: A device that inspects network traffic at an entry point to the internet and within a simple, easily defined network perimeter
A multifunctional device that inspects network traffic from the perimeter or internally, within a network that has many different entry points
questions.correct_answer: A multifunctional device that inspects network traffic from the perimeter or internally, within a network that has many different entry points

questions.question: Which solution specific to Fortinet enhances performance and reduces latency for specific features and traffic?
What criteria does FortiGate use to match traffic to a firewall policy?
Which protocol does FortiGate use to download antivirus and IPS packages?
If you configure a firewall policy with the any interface, you can view the firewall policy list only in which view?
As a best security practice when configuring administrative access to FortiGate, which protocol should you disable?
Which of the following naming formats is correct when configuring a name for a firewall address object?

Quizzes.quizz_title: Lesson 2: FortiGate NAT Configuration and Behavior

questions.question: What is a benefit of using NAT?
answer: Prevents depletion of IPv4 public address
questions.correct_answer: Prevents depletion of IPv4 public address

questions.question: Which of the following is the default VIP type?
What happens if there is no matching central SNAT policy or no central SNAT policy configured?
answer: NAT is not be applied to the firewall session.
The egress interface IP is used.
questions.correct_answer: NAT is not be applied to the firewall session.

questions.question: An administrator wants to check the total number of TCP sessions for an IP pool named INTERNAL. Which CLI command should the administrator use?
Which statement is true?
answer: Both central NAT and firewall policy NAT can be enabled together.
Central NAT is not enabled by default.
questions.correct_answer: Central NAT is not enabled by default.

questions.question: What is the default IP pool type?
Which statement about NAT66 is true?
answer: It is used to translate addresses between two IPv6 networks.
It is used to translate addresses between two IPv4 networks.
questions.correct_answer: It is used to translate addresses between two IPv6 networks.

questions.question: Which firewall authentication method does FortiGate support?
Which type of logs are application control, web filter, and antivirus?
What happens when logs roll?
answer: It lowers the space requirements needed to contain those logs.
They are uploaded to an FTP server.
questions.correct_answer: It lowers the space requirements needed to contain those logs.

questions.question: A remote LDAP user is trying to authenticate with a username and password. How does FortiGate verify the login credentials?
answer: FortiGate queries its own database for user credentials.
FortiGate sends the user-entered credentials to the remote server for verification.
questions.correct_answer: FortiGate sends the user-entered credentials to the remote server for verification.

questions.question: If you enable reliable logging, which transport protocol will FortiGate use?
Guest accounts are most commonly used for which purposes?
answer: To provide temporary visitor access to corporate network resources
To provide temporary visitor access to wireless networks
questions.correct_answer: To provide temporary visitor access to wireless networks

questions.question: When FortiGate uses a RADIUS server for remote authentication, which statement about RADIUS is true?
answer: FortiGate must query the remote RADIUS server using the distinguished name (dn).
RADIUS group memberships are provided by vendor-specific attributes (VSAs) configured on the RADIUS server
questions.correct_answer: RADIUS group memberships are provided by vendor-specific attributes (VSAs) configured on the RADIUS server

questions.question: The log ________ contains fields that are common to all log types, such as originating date and time, log identifier, log category, and VDOM.
Which protocol does FortiGate use to send encrypted logs to FortiAnalyzer?
Which storage type is preferred for logging?

Quizzes.quizz_title: Lesson 4: SSL Inspection and Web Filtering

questions.question: Which certificate extension and value is required in the FortiGate CA certificate in order to enable full SSL inspection?
Which configuration requires FortiGate to act as a CA for full SSL inspection?
answer: Multiple clients connecting to multiple servers
questions.correct_answer: Multiple clients connecting to multiple servers

questions.question: How does NGFW policy-based mode differ from profile-based mode?
answer: Policy-based flow inspection supports web profile overrides.
Policy-based flow inspection defines URL filters directly in the firewall policy.
questions.correct_answer: Policy-based flow inspection defines URL filters directly in the firewall policy.

questions.question: Which statement about proxy-based web filtering is true?
answer: It requires more resources than flow-based
It transparently analyzes the TCP flow of the traffic
questions.correct_answer: It requires more resources than flow-based

questions.question: Which is required by FortiGate to configure YouTube video filtering?
Which feature can be used for restricting websites or images from search results?
Which action in video filtering will prevent the videos from playing?
Which attribute or extension identifies the owner of a certificate?
answer: The unique serial number in the certificate
The subject name in the certificate
questions.correct_answer: The subject name in the certificate

questions.question: Which of the following is used for matching content in Web Content Filtering?
How does FortiGate determine if a certificate has been revoked?
answer: It retrieves the CRL from a directory server.
It checks the CRL that resides on FortiGate.
questions.correct_answer: It checks the CRL that resides on FortiGate.
